title: 107_s2458
content: Establishment of initiatives for predominantly Muslim countries. The Congress finds that in predominantly Muslim countries, negative opinions of the United States and its foreign policy are distorted by misinformation and propaganda, which is prejudicial to US interests. Negative opinions and images of the United States in predominantly Muslim countries are the result of misinformation and propaganda, which are highly prejudicial to US interests and foreign policy. To enhance a positive image, programs promoting familiarity with American society and values should be established. The Secretary of State will establish programs with predominantly Muslim countries to promote familiarity with American society and values, including a journalism program for foreign journalists and students. A journalism program for foreign journalists and postsecondary students will sponsor workshops and training in journalism techniques. The Secretary of State will also develop a program to assist foreign governments in improving their public library systems. The Secretary of State will develop a program to assist foreign governments in establishing or upgrading public library systems to improve literacy, education, and youth recreation centers. The program will offer training in library sciences and exchange opportunities for postsecondary study in the United States to promote American values, especially freedom and democracy. Additionally, a program will be established to provide grants to U.S. citizens for English language teaching. The program aims to promote American values, including freedom and democracy. It includes grants for U.S. citizens to work as English language teaching assistants in schools. Sister city partnerships will also be expanded to enhance global connections. The Secretary will expand sister city partnerships to increase global cooperation at the community level, focusing on economic development, municipal cooperation, health care, youth and educational programs, disability advocacy, emergency preparedness, and humanitarian assistance. Additionally, a program will be established for middle and secondary school students to visit the United States during school holidays in their home country. The Secretary will establish a program for middle and secondary school students to visit the United States during school holidays, with activities focused on cultural and educational experiences. The Secretary will establish a program for middle and secondary school students from other countries to visit the United States for cultural and educational activities, including interactions with American schools. The program aims to increase awards under the Fulbright exchange program. The Secretary aims to increase awards under the Fulbright exchange program for graduate students, scholars, professionals, teachers, and administrators from the United States to study, teach, conduct research, or pursue scholarship in predominantly Muslim countries, including subjects relating to American studies. Additionally, the Secretary will increase awards for scholars and teachers under the Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowships program. The Secretary aims to increase awards under the Fulbright exchange program for individuals from the US to study in predominantly Muslim countries, including American studies. Additionally, there will be an increase in Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowships for candidates from these countries. Programs will be carried out under specific acts. The Secretary will establish a database of American and foreign alumni of international exchange programs to promote networking and communication. Additionally, a report will be made on the inclusion of freedom and democracy advocates in educational and cultural exchange programs. The Secretary of State must submit a report to Congress within 90 days of this Act's enactment on the implementation of a specific section of the Human Rights, Refugee, and Other Foreign Relations Provisions Act of 1996. The report will detail the number of grants for exchange programs to certain countries, efforts to ensure inclusion of freedom and democracy supporters in the selection process, and an evaluation of US exchange programs. The report must detail the measures taken to ensure inclusion of freedom and democracy supporters in grant selection for exchange programs, evaluate the openness of US exchange programs in specific countries, identify obstacles, and outline steps being taken to address any issues. The Act prohibits the issuance of visas or admission to the US for inadmissible aliens. $35,000,000 is authorized for the Department of State for 2003 and 2004. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of State.
